qas.question: When was the Commonwealth of Australia created?
During what major event did Norfolk Island become an important airbase and refuelling station?
Who contructed the airbase used on Norfolk Island during World War II?

answers.text: Australian, New Zealand and United States servicemen

qas.question: Norfolk Island fell under whose responsibility during World War II?
When did N Force leave Norfolk Island during the time of World War II?
When was the Commonwealth of Australia hidden?
What minor event did Norfolk Island become an important airbase and refueling station during?

plausible_answers.text: Australian, New Zealand and United States servicemen

qas.question: Who removed the airbase used on Norfolk Island during World War II?
Whose responsibility did Norfolk Island avoid during World War II?
When did N Force leave Norfolk Island during the time of World War I?

context: After the creation of the Commonwealth of Australia in <a0_0><b5_0>1901<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Norfolk Island was placed under the authority of the new Commonwealth government to be administered as an external territory. During <a1_0><b6_0>World War II<b6_0/><a1_0/>, the island became a key airbase and refuelling depot between Australia and New Zealand, and New Zealand and the Solomon Islands. The airstrip was constructed by <a2_0><b7_0>Australian, New Zealand and United States servicemen<b7_0/><a2_0/> during 1942. Since Norfolk Island fell within <a3_0><b8_0>New Zealand<b8_0/><a3_0/>'s area of responsibility it was garrisoned by a New Zealand Army unit known as N Force at a large Army camp which had the capacity to house a 1,500 strong force. N Force relieved a company of the Second Australian Imperial Force. The island proved too remote to come under attack during the war and N Force left the island in <a4_0><b9_0>February 1944<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
